text: Practice is the best of all instructors.
To do two things at once is to do neither.
A wise man learns from the mistakes of others. A fool insists on making his own.
An army marches on its stomach. A wise general knows where the best taverns are.
The best revenge is not to be like your enemy. The second best is to outlive them.
Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts. Perseverance is more important than being right the first time.
Fortune favors the bold. Misfortune favors them as well, but tells better stories.
The bigger they are, the harder they fall. But the wiser they are, the less likely they are to fall at all.
A person's worth is measured by the worth of what they value.
Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
